name: spree
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a short period of doing a particular activity much more than is usual: I went on a drinking/shopping/spending spree on Saturday. 20 people were shot dead in the city, making it the worst killing spree since the riots. After such a spree of wins, it seems unfair to talk too much about the team's weaknesses. Compare
binge noun informal
More examplesFewer examplesHe went on the defensive in an early morning social media spree.Do we know why the suspect went on this shooting spree?After a spree last year, spending on new computer systems has fallen dramatically. A thief stole my credit card and went on a spree.

a period of time during which there is a lot of activity of a particular type, especially when this involves spending money: An ambitious public spending spree has created a huge hole in the Treasury's finances. Consumers continued their Christmas shopping spree into the New Year.on a spree Several large corporations took advantage of the volatile stock market to go on an acquisition spree.
